page.lettertext:
fol.259r
1592 25 July To M
r
Bodly
Right Worshipfull daies past we sent a l
re
unto you
w
th
oone from ou
r
government at
London
and soche copies as was
most nidfull for the matter your wo
r
haith in hand for us
W
th
the
generall statt
: we hope the will deall well w
th
the companey, and will give us all resonable content./
Yf aney of the m
r
chant
of those
tt
should be apoynted to come
unto the Hage against the tyme apoynted w
ch
is the xv
th
august next, and that you might understand the same,
ytt maie Please you to
s
tiffie thereof, and then we will
also apoynt some of ou
r
People to goe thether also to
meatt w
th
them, but yf none come thether, then we doe
meane to send only
Joseph Whiller
to attend uppon you
r
wo
r
./
I having this good conveance have thought good to wrytt thes
fewe lyns, ending w
th
myne, and my
wiffes
, verry harty comen
dations unto you
r
wo
r
, p
r
ing god to blesse all your
good
Actions./ Amen./ Midelborch. 25th July 1592.
Yours to be comanded assuredly Thomas Ferrers Deputy.
